thread.title: ODU rallies late to beat Charlotte; snaps 3 game slide
thread.title_full: ODU rallies late to beat Charlotte; snaps 3 game slide

title: ODU rallies late to beat Charlotte; snaps 3 game slide
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest ODU rallies late to beat Charlotte; snaps 3 game slide NORFOLK, VA -With 2:18 left in the fourth quarter, David Washington found an open Zach Pascal for an 11-yard touchdown to give the Monarchs their Post to Facebook ODU rallies late to beat Charlotte; snaps 3 game slide NORFOLK, VA -With 2:18 left in the fourth quarter, David Washington found an open Zach Pascal for an 11-yard touchdown to give the Monarchs their  //on.wvec.com/1LBjvYk   ODU rallies late to beat Charlotte; snaps 3 game slide ODU Athletics 8:37 p.m. EDT October 17, 2015 ODU's David Washington passed for 4 touchdowns as they won over Charlotte 37-34. (Photo: 13News Now) CONNECT TWEET   
NORFOLK, VA -With 2:18 left in the fourth quarter, David Washington found an open Zach Pascal for an 11-yard touchdown to give the Monarchs their first lead of the contest (35-34) and succeeded on their two-point conversion to post a 37-34 victory over the Charlotte 49ers. 
Charlotte entered the fourth quarter with a slight two-point lead (24-22) and opened with a 14-play, 79-yard drive capped off by a one-yard touchdown run by Matt Johnson to hold a 31-22 advantage. ODU pulled within two points 3:50 later when Washington found Pascal for a 15-yard score. The ODU defense held the 49ers to a field goal on their ensuing drive to knot the score at 34-29 with 5:11 on the clock. The next ODU possession, which proved to be the game-winning drive, lasted 2:59 and featured nine plays for 75 yards. Jonathan Duhart caught the pass from Washington for the two-point conversion, despite the officials calling defensive pass interference. 
Charlotte took over with 2:18 on the clock, and made it all the way to the ODU 40-yard line. Oshane Ximines sacked Lee McNeill for a seven-yard loss on first down and the defense forced an incomplete pass on fouth-and-13 to secure the victory. 
ODU's offense was paced by Washington, who tallied two career-highs with 365 yards and four touchdowns. He went 25-for-43, with his longest toss being 53 yards. Pascal led all recievers with 231 yards in the air and three touchdowns. Jeremy Cox ran for 46 yards to led the Monarchs' rushers. TJ Ricks also set a career-high with 18 tackles, including a solo sack and two tackles for a loss. Felonte Misher added 14 tackles on defense and one for a loss. 
Kalif Phillips rushed for 204 yards and two touchdowns to lead the 49ers, while Trent Bostick led the recievers with 57 yards. McNeill passed for 219 yards, going 23-for-33 with one interception. On defense, Nick Cook registered eight tackles and Caleb Clayton-Molby netted seven tackles, including one for a loss.  //on.wvec.com/1LBjvYk TOP VIDEOS
